ex_chs: 广东话俗语：象征有实力或魄力的人跨地域闯荡,对相貌不佳者的戏称暗含对外貌与自信的讽刺 "没有真本事的人不敢出来闯荡，只有不够漂亮的人才需要浓妆艳抹"
ex_en: Cantonese proverb: Symbolizing someone with ability or courage venturing out into new regions, it's also a sarcastic term for someone with an unattractive appearance, subtly mocking their looks and self-confidence. "Those without real talent dare not venture out; only those who aren't pretty enough need heavy makeup."

ex_chs: 用于骂人，形容人像木桩那样站在那里不动。当时英国的木条叫mullion，指着叫华人拿起来装上，不会英语的我们听成茂利，在取笑同僚“在说你呢，一根木头那样站在这愣着”
ex_en: It was used as an insult to describe someone standing there motionless like a wooden stake. At the time, the British called a "mullion," and when they pointed at it, they were telling the Chinese to pick it up and install it. We, who didn't understand English, misheard it as "Maoli" and were mocking our colleague, saying, "We're talking about you, standing here like a log, completely dazed."

They were chatting furtively.

ex_zhh: 佢誓神劈願同我講，佢已經收手
ex_chs: 他斩钉截铁地和我说，他已经不做了
ex_en: He told me firmly that he was no longer doing it.

ex_zhh: 佢做嘢成日甩轆，新項目唔好預佢啦，咪搞着自己
ex_chs: 他做事经常出问题，新项目不要让他参加，不然只会给自己添麻烦
ex_en: He often makes mistakes; don't let him participate in new projects, or he'll only cause trouble for himself.

ex_zhh: 佢條友仔咁甩碌，點可能如期交到貨俾你。
ex_chs: 他是个不负责任的人，怎么可能按时把工作交给你？
ex_en: He is an irresponsible guy, how can he give you the work in time.
Very busy

ex_zhh: 你今日好似失魂咁喎。/你今日好似short 咗咁喎。/你今日好似甩轆咁喎。
ex_chs: 你今天好像反应慢 / 不在状态。
ex_en: You seem slow to react or out of sorts today.

ex_zhh: 你唔好到嗰日甩轆吖/你唔好到嗰日放飛機吖
ex_chs: 你不要到那一天就放我们鸽子啊
ex_en: Don't stand us up on that day!
